title: FF has "looping" issue within a modem console, Opera doesn't.
content:
Running FF115.23.1ESR on a Win7/32 box I use in network maintenance/configuration.

If I log into the modem main page and select from the side-bar menu, FF drops me back to the modem's login screen (Grounghog Day style). This behaviour is repeatable (endlessly) on:

  • * another identical modem (same/latest firmware). These have repeatedly been factory reset and firmware reloaded. No change.
  • * another Win7 box (/64) on same FF release.

Opera - reluctantly added on those same Win7 boxes - does not have this (mis-)behaviour.

Win10/64 running FF138.0.4 does not have this issue.

Up until about ten weeks back, the (then-current) Win7/X esr release did NOT have this problem.

Yes, I HAVE cleared cache/cookies repeatedly before sessions, to no avail. <><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><>

Q1: Anyone have any experience like this, or any clues/suggestions?

Q2: To continue using these Win7 boxes in that role, am I forced to abandon FF?
creator: pedro_2000

title: Publisher's Clearing House (PCH.com) search function
content: Recently when I try to use the PCH.com search in their emails, I get this message; "HTTP Error 400. The size of the request headers is too long." Is this a PCH problem or Firefox and can I fix it?
creator: hrsteeley

title: Can't pin or remove extension tools from the toolbar.
content:
I am currently running version 138.0.4 (64 bit). I have not been able to add any extension's tool to the toolbar. It used to be that a left-click on the "Extensions" tool produced a drop down window with a list of installed extensions and the option to and/remove any extension from the toolbar. Things still work this way with Microsoft Edge (Chromium) and Google Chrome. Left-clicking the new Firefox "unified extensions tool" opens an Add-ons Manager with "Recommendations", "Extensions", "Themes" and "Plugins". Clicking on "Extensions" does list the extensions I have installed, but there is no way to add the tools for those extensions to the toolbar.

Please, please, please put to original "Extensions" tool back on the toolbar. If you must add a tool to the toolbar for the "Add-ons Manager", do it. I actually think that would be a very good idea. Call the tool "Add-ons Manager", NOT "Extensions"!

NOTE: the computer I am running Firefox on in this instance does have my desired tools in the toolbar. I installed Firefox on this machine long before the newer versions of Firefox were released. I have used Firefox for years as my default browser on several computers over the years.

Thank you, William A. Butcher
creator: wbutcher8

title: Can't access accounts
content:
I have cleared my cache, my history, disabled all addons, added sites to my exceptions list for popups and for my virus and malware protection, the works. I still cannot log into Ko-fi nor any site that requires proof I am human. I have had to use Chrome, which is ridiculously unsecure. I have contacted Ko-fi and they have no answer. I cannot access these sites on my tablet nor my desktop, just my phone. Using just my phone is very tedious, especially for anything where I need to type things.

Does anyone know what is happening that could cause this?
creator: Chaosfay
